javelin.view.screen

Class BattleScreen

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Panel
          • tyrant.mikera.tyrant.TPanel
            • tyrant.mikera.tyrant.Screen
              • javelin.view.screen.BattleScreen
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    WorldScreen

    public class BattleScreen
extends tyrant.mikera.tyrant.Screen
    Screen context during battle. TODO it has become a hierarchy that behaves how different types of Fights should behave. The ideal would be for all this type of controller behavior to move to Fight. For example: LairScreen . TODO the 2.0 interface should absolutely not be redrawn every time, only when an update is needed and even then the redraw should be on a tile-by-tile basis, not the entire screen. TODO many things this is actually handling should be moved to Fight controllers instead.
    Author:
    alex
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • mainLoop

        public void mainLoop()
        this is the main game loop. it catches any exceptions for stability and lets the game continue
        very important that endTurn() gets called after the player moves, this ensures that the rest of the map stays up to date
